definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: The new typist is green at her job.
sentences.chinese: 刚来的打字员是个熟手。

sentences.english: We also need volunteers, skilled and general.
sentences.chinese: 我们也需要志愿者，熟手和普通的。

sentences.english: He's an old hand at fixing cars.
sentences.chinese: 他是补缀汽车的熟手在行。

sentences.english: We’re predicting a real shortage in the next decade of skilled workers.
sentences.chinese: 我们预测在下一个十年，有技能的熟手比较稀缺。

sentences.english: In default of experienced hands, count the few of us among the number.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有熟手，就把我们几个也算进去吧。

sentences.english: We have more than 100 skilled craftsmen.
sentences.chinese: 我们有百多名熟手技工。

definition: novice/new hand/sb new to a job
experienced person/an old hand at sth
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to help with farm work/casual laborer
to act in a supporting role/fig. to play second fiddle
